reviews.review_msg: Best lecture I've ever had in SFU! He makes his lectures so interesting and now am deeply in love with Chinese history just because of him!! I'll take his lecture no matter what class he's teaching in SFU! So professional in his field and he even able to speak Chinese fluently! His exam and assignments are highly corresponding with lecture!

Amazing lectures - but 90% of the class were econ or commerce students who could barely speak English - Green's incredible lectures on Chinese history were wasted on them (when they even bothered to show up). He made the assignments easy, cut back on the reading, and spoon-fed them the answers and they still complained.  Great Prof!
The Best pro! Always well organized, and the lecture is interesting.

Really a nice prof!! he gave clear and organized lectures.  the three document analyses and exams were all cover in his lecture.  attend every lecture and take notes on he slides then you will be fine with exams and assignments.

Probably the best prof i ever had in SFU, but ironically, he isn't originally a SFU prof. I finally learned about "China" after taking his class for two terms. His teaching really makes me think, and explains perfectly what makes China "China" today. I would definitely register in UBC and continue to take his class. Green is simply the BEST!

Superb prof. Good prep, and he's passionate about what he does. He's an excellent speaker and really keeps your attention. Really knows his stuff, also fluent in Mandarin Chinese, and can explain why it's called Mandarin :D

The best prof i have so far, even though Colin is a part-time prof at SFU. His huge interest in China makes him passionate about the topic he is teaching. Exams are fair and creative thinking is highly encouraged. Take his class! Whether for requirement or elective!
